repo_notes.content: Rapida: Open-source voice AI orchestration platform. Get services running in 4 commands. Built with Go, gRPC, and designed for developers.

pages.title: Quick Start
pages.purpose: Get all services running in 4 simple commands using Docker. Covers clone, setup, build, and start.

page_notes.content: This is the first thing developers see. Should be action-focused, not explanatory.

pages.title: Features & Principles
pages.purpose: Introduce Rapida's core capabilities: real-time voice orchestration, LLM-agnostic architecture, production reliability, observability, tooling, and enterprise readiness

page_notes.content: High-level overview of what Rapida does and why it matters.

pages.title: Development
pages.purpose: Guide developers on working with services locally: starting specific services, viewing logs, rebuilding after code changes, and configuring environment variables

page_notes.content: Focus on practical workflows for developers actively building on Rapida.

pages.title: Deployment
pages.purpose: Cover Docker Compose production setup, Kubernetes, and cloud platform deployments (AWS, GCP, Azure)

page_notes.content: For teams ready to deploy beyond local development.

pages.title: Troubleshooting & Commands
pages.purpose: Quick reference for common issues, Makefile commands, and debugging steps

page_notes.content: Concise troubleshooting guide in the README.

pages.title: Configuration System
pages.purpose: Deep dive into service configuration: environment variables, AppConfig structure, service-specific settings, and how settings propagate

page_notes.content: For detailed documentation site (doc.rapida.ai), not README.

pages.title: Application Configuration
pages.purpose: Technical documentation: AppConfig struct, required fields, validation, loading mechanisms

pages.title: Environment Variables
pages.purpose: Complete list of all environment variables across services: database, Redis, LLM APIs, telephony credentials, logging

pages.title: Data Layer
pages.purpose: Architecture documentation: PostgreSQL, Redis, OpenSearch; Connector abstraction; schemas; caching strategies

pages.title: Database Connectors
pages.purpose: Implementation details: Connector interface, PostgresConnector, RedisConnector, OpenSearchConnector

page_notes.content: For developers working with data layer.

pages.title: Database Schemas
pages.purpose: Schema reference: assistant conversations, endpoints, integrations, deployments, relationships, migrations

pages.title: Caching Strategy
pages.purpose: Redis usage patterns: query caching, session management, cache invalidation, TTL policies

pages.title: Microservices
pages.purpose: Architecture overview: microservices design, service responsibilities, inter-service gRPC communication, ports

page_notes.content: Entry point for understanding service boundaries.

pages.title: Web API
pages.purpose: Service documentation: primary backend (port 9001), authentication, REST routing, request handling

pages.title: Assistant API
pages.purpose: Service documentation: voice orchestration (port 9007), conversation management, GenericRequestor, audio pipelines

pages.title: Endpoint API
pages.purpose: Service documentation: LLM endpoint management (port 9005), caching, retry policies, endpoint versioning

pages.title: Integration API
pages.purpose: Service documentation: external integrations (port 9004), webhook handling, audit logging, third-party connectors

pages.title: Document API
pages.purpose: Service documentation: document processing (port 9010), knowledge base management, vector search, embeddings

pages.title: Voice Orchestration
pages.purpose: Core architecture: conversation lifecycle, state management, real-time audio processing, call flow

page_notes.content: Central to understanding Rapida's orchestration engine.

pages.title: Conversation Management
pages.purpose: Implementation: conversation creation, message handling, state transitions, interruptions, recording, event streaming

pages.title: Audio Input Processing
pages.purpose: Audio pipeline: preprocessing, denoising (RNNoise), VAD (Silero), end-of-speech detection, buffering, normalization

pages.title: Audio Output Processing
pages.purpose: Audio pipeline: TTS synthesis, buffering (20ms chunks), interruption handling, streaming delivery, format handling

pages.title: Telephony Integration
pages.purpose: Overview: telephony provider support (Twilio, Vonage, Exotel), call control, WebSocket streaming, audio formats

page_notes.content: Foundation for telephony implementations. See provider-specific READMEs.

pages.title: Telephony Interface
pages.purpose: Core abstraction: Telephony and Streamer interfaces, common methods (MakeCall, IncomingCall, StatusCallback, Streamer)

page_notes.content: Required interface for new telephony providers.

pages.title: Twilio Integration
pages.purpose: Provider implementation: TwiML generation, WebSocket streaming, Î¼-law audio handling (8kHz), event format

pages.title: Vonage Integration
pages.purpose: Provider implementation: NCCO generation, WebSocket streaming, PCM audio handling (16kHz), JSON event format

pages.title: Exotel Integration
pages.purpose: Provider implementation: custom field routing, WebSocket streaming, flexible audio format support, JSON events

pages.title: AI Provider Integration
pages.purpose: Overview: transformer architecture for STT and TTS, supporting multiple AI providers with unified interface

page_notes.content: Foundation for AI provider implementations. See provider-specific READMEs.

pages.title: Speech-to-Text Transformers
pages.purpose: STT implementations: SpeechToTextTransformer interface, providers (Google, Deepgram, Sarvam, AssemblyAI, Cartesia), audio format handling

pages.title: Text-to-Speech Transformers
pages.purpose: TTS implementations: TextToSpeechTransformer interface, providers (Google, Deepgram, Sarvam, Cartesia, Elevenlabs, Resemble), streaming audio

pages.title: Provider Configuration
pages.purpose: Technical reference: audio format mapping, credential management, model options, provider-specific settings, initialization options

page_notes.content: For configuring and extending AI providers.

pages.title: Frontend
pages.purpose: React UI (port 3000): voice agent interface, conversation UI, activity monitoring, provider/model configuration, deployment management
